intro: Bistorta lapidosa, commonly known as the stone bistorta, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant features a rhizomatous root system and produces tall, erect stems covered in soft, hairy foliage. Its flowers are small, clustered in dense spikes, and typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. Bistorta lapidosa is adapted to harsh, cold environments and is often found growing in rocky or gravelly soils.
